sen.j: 若狭湾国定公園（わかさわんこくていこうえん）は、福井県敦賀市の笙の川河口左岸から京都府舞鶴市の由良川河口右岸に至る、若狭湾に面した海岸線を中心に指定された国定公園。
sen.e: Wakasa Wan Quasi-National Park was designated to cover the area including mainly the coastline facing Wakasa Bay from the left bank at the mouth of Shono-kawa River of Tsuruga City, Fukui Prefecture to the right bank at the mouth of Yura-gawa River of Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture.

Wakasa Wan Quasi-National Park was designated as covering an area which includes the coastline around Wakasa Bay from the left bank of the mouth of Shono-kawa River in Tsuruga City, Fukui Prefecture, to the right bank of the mouth of Yura-gawa River in Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture.

Wakasa Bay Quasi-National Park was designated as covering an area which includes the coastline around Wakasa Bay from the left bank of the mouth of the Shono-kawa River in Tsuruga City, Fukui Prefecture, to the right bank of the mouth of the Yura-gawa River in Maizuru City, Kyoto Prefecture.
sen.cmt: Wakasa Bay としました。"Shono-kawa River"→"the Shono-kawa River"に変更しました。"Yura-gawa River"→"the Yura-gawa River"に変更しました。

sen.j: 2007年8月時点での総面積は約19,194 ヘクタール。
sen.e: In August 2007, its total area was 191,940,000 m2.
In August 2007, its total area was 191,940,000 m2.
In August 2007, its total area was 191,940,000 square meters.

sen.j: かつては京都府京丹後市にある丹後半島北部を西端としていたが、由良川以西の区域は独立し丹後天橋立大江山国定公園の一部となっている。
sen.e: It had once covered the northern part of Tango Peninsula in Kyotango City, Kyoto Prefecture, but now the area of Yura-gawa River and west of it is part of Tango-Amanohashidate-Oeyama Quasi-National Park.

It had once covered the northern part of Tango Peninsula in Kyotango City, Kyoto Prefecture, but now the area of the Yura-gawa River and to the west is part of Tango-Amanohashidate-Oeyama Quasi-National Park.

It had once covered the northern part of Tango Peninsula in Kyotango City, Kyoto Prefecture, but now the area of the Yura-gawa River and to the west is part of Tango-Amanohashidate-Oeyama Quasi-National Park.

sen.j: 若狭湾は典型的なリアス式海岸で、断崖・洞門・洞窟・岩礁などの風景要素が人気である。
sen.e: The sawtooth coastline facing Wakasa Bay is popular among tourists with its various views of cliffs, tunnels of rocks, caves, and reefs.
The sawtooth coastline facing Wakasa Bay is popular among tourists with its varied views of cliffs, rock tunnels, caves and reefs.
The sawtooth coastline facing Wakasa Bay is popular among tourists with its varied views of cliffs, rock tunnels, caves and reefs.

sen.j: 公園は同湾岸周辺のほか、湾に浮かぶ特別保護地区の冠島・沓島、海中公園の三方海中公園、ラムサール条約指定湿地となっている三方五湖およびその周辺を含有している。
sen.e: This park covers the following: the area around the coastline of Wakasa Bay: Kanmuri-jima Island and Kutsu-jima island which are special protection areas within the bay: Mikata Marine park: Mikata Goko (Five Lakes of Mikata) which is the wetland designated by the Ramsar Convention, and its neighborhood.

The park covers the following: the area around the coastline of Wakasa Bay, Kanmuri-jima Island and Kutsu-jima island which are specially protected areas within the bay, Mikata Marine park, Mikata Goko (Five Lakes of Mikata), a wetland designated by the Ramsar Convention, and its neighborhood.

The park covers the following: the area around the coastline of Wakasa Bay, Kanmuri-jima Island and Kutsu-jima Island which are specially protected areas within the bay, Mikata Marine park, Mikata Goko (Five Lakes of Mikata), a wetland designated by the Ramsar Convention, and its neighborhood.
sen.cmt: Island 大文字にしました。

sen.j: 1955年6月1日 海岸線約115 キロメートルなどを国定公園に指定。
sen.e: On June 1, 1955, its coastline of approximately 115 km was designated as the Quasi-National Park.
On June 1, 1955, coastline of approximately 115 km was designated as the Quasi-National Park.
June 1, 1955: Coastline of approximately 115 km was designated as the Quasi-National Park.

sen.j: 2007年8月3日 由良川以西の地域が、新たな地域を加えた上で新設の丹後天橋立大江山国定公園として独立のため指定区域から削除、同時に由良川以東では海岸後背地など指定区域を拡張、冠島・沓島を特別保護地域に格上げ。
sen.e: On August 3, 2007, the area of Yura-gawa River and west of it was removed to join the newly established Tango-Amanohashidate-Oeyama Quasi-National Park along with some additional areas, and in addition to the east area to Yura-gawa River, the park gained some backlands of the coast, with Kanmuri-jima Island and Kutsu-jima island being upgraded to special protection areas.

On August 3, 2007, the area of the Yura-gawa River and to the west was removed to join the newly established Tango-Amanohashidate-Oeyama Quasi-National Park along with some additional areas, however the park was extended to cover further areas to the east to Yura-gawa River, and in some areas expanded inland, with Kanmuri-jima Island and Kutsu-jima island being upgraded to special protection areas.

August 3, 2007: The area of the Yura-gawa River and to the west was removed to join the newly established Tango-Amanohashidate-Oeyama Quasi-National Park along with some additional areas, however the park was extended to cover further areas to the east to Yura-gawa River, and in some areas expanded inland, with Kanmuri-jima Island and Kutsu-jima Island being upgraded to special protection areas.
sen.cmt: Island 大文字にしました。On "August 3, 2007,"→"August 3, 2007:"に変更しました。

tit.cmt: I assume the 関係 here means that these are municipalities and prefectures that are related to the Wakasa Bay Quasi-National Park in the sense that the park covers an area that includes the two prefectures listed below and the cities, etc., are presumably also within the confines of the park's area. If that is the case, then "Related municipalities and prefectures" should be fine.

sen.cmt: 住所表記を統一しました。
住所表記を統一しました。
住所表記を統一しました。
住所表記を統一しました。

tit.cmt: ピリオドを削除しました。

sen.e: Kehi no Matsubara (a scenic beach with many beautiful pine trees)
Kehi no Matsubara (a scenic beach with many beautiful pine trees)
Kehi no Matsubara (a scenic beach with many beautiful pine trees)
Mikata Goko (三方五湖) (Five Lakes of Mikata)
Mikata Goko (三方五湖) (Five Lakes of Mikata)
Mikata Goko (三方五湖) (Five Lakes of Mikata)
Sotomon (蘇洞門) (a gate-like rock on the seaside which a small boat can pass through)
Sotomon (蘇洞門) (a gate-like rock on the coast which small boats can pass through)
Sotomon (蘇洞門) (a gate-like rock on the coast which small boats can pass through)
